Ini Upaya Menkominfo Antisipasi Spyware Pegasus di WhatsApp
06 Nov 2019, 10:31 by Tim detikINET - detikInet


Foto: Agus Tri Haryanto/detikINET

Jakarta - Spyware Pegasus ramai dibahas lantaran mampu menjebol WhatsApp. Lantas apa usaha Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika untuk menangkal Pegasus?Pertanyaan itu sempat disodorkan Komisi I DPR RI, Anggota DPR RI Sukamta saat rapat kerja dengan Menteri Komunikasi dan Informatika (Menkominfo) Johnny G Plate di Gedung DPR, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11).Menkominfo pun menjawab pihaknya akan bekerja sama dengan Badan Siber dan Sandi Negara (BSSN) untuk menjaga pertahanan siber Indonesia dari serangan spyware Pegasus.Johnny menjelaskan Kominfo akan bertukar informasi dengan BSSN terkait keberadaan Pegasus di Indonesia. Hal ini dilakukan sebagai langkah untuk mencegah serangan Pegasus."Hal-hal yang geo-strategis tentu kita harus berbicara dengan lembaga yang berkompeten, yaitu BSSN. Kominfo setelah ini saya akan melihat patroli siber Kominfo," kata Johnny seperti dilansir dari CNN Indonesia.Seperti diketahui Serangan Pegasus ini diduga terjadi bulan Mei 2019 kepada 1.400 pengguna WhatsApp di seluruh dunia, memanfaatkan celah keamanan di video call WhatsApp. Setidaknya 100 orang korban adalah para aktivis politik dan HAM, wartawan atau pejabat pemerintahan.

This Minister of Communication and Information Efforts Anticipate Pegasus Spyware on WhatsApp
Nov 06 2019, 10:31 by Tim detikINET - detikInet


Photo: Agus Tri Haryanto / detikINET

Jakarta - Spyware Pegasus is widely discussed because it is able to break down WhatsApp. So what was the Ministry of Communication and Information's effort to ward off Pegasus? The question was offered by Commission I of the Indonesian Parliament, Member of the Republic of Indonesia Sukamta during a working meeting with the Minister of Communication and Information (Menkominfo) Johnny G Plate at the Parliament Building, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5) The Minister of Communication and Information answered that he would work closely with the National Siber and State Agency (BSSN) to protect Indonesia's cyber defense against spyware attacks from Pegasus. Johnny explained Kominfo would exchange information with BSSN regarding Pegasus's presence in Indonesia. This is done as a step to prevent the Pegasus attack. "Geo-strategic things, of course we have to talk to competent institutions, namely BSSN. Kominfo after this I will see Kominfo cyber patrols," Johnny said as reported by CNN Indonesia. It is known that this Pegasus attack allegedly occurred in May 2019 to 1,400 WhatsApp users worldwide, exploiting security holes in WhatsApp video calls. At least 100 victims were political and human rights activists, journalists or government officials.
